title: ‘It’s good to see racism lose’: Guilty verdicts are hailed in the Arbery case.
content: The murder convictions of three white men in the death of Ahmaud Arbery were praised by many as a just outcome in a case that could have stoked racial divisions.

more_info.byline: By Jack Healy and Tariro Mzezewa

title: All three men were convicted of murdering Ahmaud Arbery, but only one was convicted of ‘malice murder.’
content: In convicting Travis McMichael on that charge, the 12 jurors found that he had deliberately intended to kill Mr. Arbery.

more_info.byline: By Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs and Giulia Heyward

title: G.O.P. Fights Covid Mandates, Then Blames Biden as Cases Rise
content: Republicans have fought mask requirements and vaccine mandates for months, but as coronavirus infections again rise, they are blaming the president for failing to end the health crisis.

title: For Afghan Refugees, a Choice Between Community and Opportunity
content: In resettling thousands of displaced Afghans, the Biden administration must weigh their need for support against the needs of the U.S. labor market.

more_info.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Jim Tankersley

title: Charlottesville Extremists Lose in Court, but Replacement Theory Lives On
content: Organizers of the “Unite the Right” demonstration suffered a damaging legal defeat this week. But four years after the rally, their message has seeped closer to the conservative mainstream.

title: At Least 27 Dead After Migrant Boat Capsizes in English Channel
content: The boat, which capsized near Calais, had been carrying a group of migrants to Britain. “France won’t let the Channel become a graveyard,’’ President Emmanuel Macron said.

more_info.byline: By Aurelien Breeden, Constant Méheut and Norimitsu Onishi

title: Trump Investigation Enters Crucial Phase as Prosecutor’s Term Nears End
content: New developments suggest the long-running inquiry has returned to an earlier focus: the valuations the former president and his family business applied to properties as it sought loans.

more_info.byline: By Ben Protess, William K. Rashbaum, Jonah E. Bromwich and David Enrich

title: He Convinced Voters He Would Be Like Merkel. But Who Is Olaf Scholz?
content: Germany’s next chancellor is something of an enigma. He comes to power with a dizzying array of challenges, raising questions about whether he can fill the very big shoes of his predecessor.

title: Do Sports Still Need China?
content: Global outrage, broken contracts and shifting politics could change the calculus for leagues and teams that once raced to do business in China.

title: He’s the Brusque Mr. Fix-It for Mexico City’s Accordions
content: For 50 years, Francisco Luis Ramírez has been the go-to guy for instrument repairs in a nation that reveres the accordion. Now it’s a family business.

title: El artesano de los acordeones de Ciudad de México
content: Durante 50 años, Francisco Luis Ramírez se ha encargado de reparar acordeones en un país que venera ese instrumento. Ahora es un negocio familiar.

title: Here’s the Secret to the Best Mashed Potatoes for Thanksgiving
content: You’ve tried boiling, but Genevieve Ko found a better way to make this side dish fluffier — and more flavorful.

title: ‘I Can’t Just Quit’
content: Sika Henry is the first African American woman to be recognized as a pro triathlete. But a horrible bicycle crash in 2019 nearly thwarted her dream.

title: Feeling Rich in the Yeezy Gap Jacket
content: If you love to talk to people, this is the coat for you.

title: Vote For the Best Book
content: We asked readers to nominate their favorite books published in the past 125 years. Help us choose the very best, based on this list of finalists.

title: What the Arbery and Rittenhouse Verdicts Couldn’t Tell Us
content: We must stop tying our hopes for justice to high-profile criminal cases.

title: I Was With Family. Suddenly, a White Man Appeared with a Gun.
content: We do not just remember the death. We remember the life, the beauty, the art, the feeling, the waiting, the living.

title: I Grew Up Poor. How Am I Supposed to Raise My Middle-Class Kids?
content: My children do not understand my world and I do not understand theirs.

title: The Republicans We’re Thankful For
content: There are some in the G.O.P. who reject its worst antidemocratic impulses. We should celebrate them.

title: The No Good, Very Bad Truth About the Internet and Our Kids
content: Our kids are at the mercy of tech companies, with only an outdated law to protect them.

more_info.byline: By Adam Westbrook, Lucy King and Jonah M. Kessel

title: Trump Wanted to Punish China. We’re Still Paying for It.
content: An import tax on chassis is contributing to inflation and port congestion. The government needs to find better ways of increasing manufacturing.

title: How to Find Common Ground With Your Most Problematic Family Members
content: To survive a dinner table disagreement with the people you love this Thanksgiving, don’t call it a debate, Dylan Marron argues.

title: Why Some Dads Don’t Take Leave: They Think They’ll Be Punished
content: Until everyone has it, paid parental leave will be seen as nonessential.

title: Hong Kong’s Universities Have Fallen. There May Be No Turning Back.
content: Shrinking the public space that preserves the memory of the 1989 Beijing uprising has effectively turned Hong Kong into another silent mainland city.

more_info.byline: By Shui-yin Sharon Yam and Alex Chow

title: ‘Justice Was Served’: Guilty Verdicts in the Ahmaud Arbery Case
content: Readers express relief. One calls it the “only rational and equitable verdict.” Also: A Covid Thanksgiving, and one in prison; children and grief.

title: Can Liberals Survive Progressivism?
content: The main threat to the Democratic Party comes from the left.

title: Who Deserves a Lifesaving Organ?
content: Evaluation for transplant is an area of medicine where subjective criteria, like whether a person has strong family support, can determine access.

title: Where Should You Live?
content: Take our quiz.

more_info.byline: By Gus Wezerek and Yaryna Serkez

title: Everyone’s Moving to Texas. Here’s Why.
content: We studied 16,847 places to find out why Dallas is so popular.

more_info.byline: By Farhad Manjoo, Gus Wezerek and Yaryna Serkez

title: Epstein’s Final Days: Celebrity Reminiscing and a Running Toilet
content: Newly released records show the disgraced financier living a mundane existence in jail before his suicide, while also spinning deceptions until the very end.

more_info.byline: By Benjamin Weiser, Matthew Goldstein, Danielle Ivory and Steve Eder

title: Jury Finds Rally Organizers Responsible for Charlottesville Violence
content: Jurors found the main organizers of the deadly far-right rally in Charlottesville, Va., in 2017 liable under state law, awarding more than $25 million in damages, but deadlocked on federal conspiracy charges.

title: CVS, Walgreens and Walmart Fueled Opioid Crisis, Jury Finds
content: This is the first jury verdict in an opioid case. The decision embraced a key legal argument that judges in other opioid cases had recently rejected.

title: As Virus Cases Rise in Europe, an Economic Toll Returns
content: A series of restrictions, including a lockdown in Austria, is expected to put a brake on economic growth.

more_info.byline: By Patricia Cohen and Melissa Eddy

title: Hayao Miyazaki Prepares to Cast One Last Spell
content: No artist has explored the contradictions of humanity as sympathetically and critically as the Japanese animation legend. Now, at 80, he’s coming out of retirement with another movie.

title: Ahmaud Arbery, Germany, Thanksgiving: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
content: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Why Is Murder Spiking? And Can Cities Address It Without Police?
content: What a progressive vision of public safety could look like.

title: The Farmers Revolt in India
content: How agricultural workers organized, protested and faced down Prime Minister Narendra Modi — and scored an unlikely victory.

more_info.byline: By Michael Barbaro, Sydney Harper, Mooj Zadie, Luke Vander Ploeg, Asthaa Chaturvedi, Jessica Cheung, Dave Shaw and Chris Wood

title: The Inflation Miscalculation Complicating Biden’s Agenda
content: Administration officials blame the Delta variant for a prolonged stretch of consumer spending on goods, rather than services, pushing up prices and creating a conundrum for the Fed.

title: N.F.L. to Settle Lawsuit Over Rams’ Relocation for $790 Million
content: Rams owner Stanley Kroenke is expected to pay the entire amount, ending the four-year court battle over the team’s move to Los Angeles in 2016.

title: Helicopters, Clipboards, Crew Cuts: The President Must Be in Town
content: President Biden and his family are spending Thanksgiving on Nantucket, renewing a family tradition that dates back to 1975.

title: California Leaders Vow to Crack Down After High-Profile Burglaries
content: “Their plan was to overwhelm us,” Chief Bill Scott of the San Francisco police said after about a dozen stores were stolen from in one night.

title: She Ran a Bronx Homeless Shelter. Here’s What She Spent Millions On.
content: A shelter operator admitted using money from the city to cover personal expenses, including shopping sprees at Neiman Marcus and Manolo Blahnik.

title: Why Columbia Student Workers Are Back On Strike
content: Columbia University’s student workers’ union, made up of 3,000 workers, is striking for the second time this year, calling for higher wages and more protections.

title: Margo Guryan, Whose Album Drew Belated Acclaim, Dies at 84
content: She recorded “Take a Picture” in 1968, but it died when she declined to tour. Three decades later, adventurous listeners discovered it and gave it a new life.

title: Karim Benzema, French Soccer Star, Is Convicted in Sex Tape Scandal
content: The Real Madrid striker was found guilty of being part of an attempt to blackmail a fellow player, charges that had led to his being dropped from his national team for more than five years.

title: British Lawmaker Is Reprimanded for Bringing Her Baby to a Debate
content: Stella Creasy received a letter of complaint for attending a debate with her infant son in tow. After an outcry, the speaker of the House of Commons said that a committee would review the rules.

title: The Novel That Riveted France During Lockdown Arrives in the U.S.
content: “The Anomaly,” by Hervé Le Tellier, sold more than a million copies during an anomalous time. Now the genre-bending novel is translated into English.

title: Get Ready for the Baby Yoda Balloon
content: A helium-filled Grogu designed by the toy company Funko will fly above the streets of New York in the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade.

title: Jon Batiste on His 11 Grammy Nominations: ‘I’m So Over the Moon’
content: The jazz pianist and bandleader on “The Late Show With Stephen Colbert” received the most nominations for the 2022 awards. Music “connects us to the sacred, the divine,” he said.

title: Review: A Tale of Two Hawkeyes
content: Disney+’s new Marvel series, “Hawkeye,” finally gives Jeremy Renner a headlining role — as mentor and straight man.

title: Review: The Met Opera’s ‘Eurydice’ Tries to Raise the Dead
content: The composer Matthew Aucoin and Sarah Ruhl’s teeming, wearying adaptation of her play is a contemporary vision of the Orpheus myth.

title: How Exercise Affects Your Appetite
content: For most of us, exercise impacts our hunger and weight in unexpected and sometimes contradictory ways.

title: How to Save Your Knees Without Giving Up Your Workout
content: There’s no magic bullet to knee health, but staying active and building muscles around the joint are crucial.

title: Don’t Rinse the Bird. A Myth to Dispel Before the Holidays.
content: Many home cooks wash the chicken or turkey before cooking, but that only increases the risk of food-borne illness.

more_info.byline: By Lydia Zuraw, Kaiser Health News

title: Don’t Let Food Poisoning Ruin Your Holiday
content: Recent outbreaks from flour and more are good reasons to keep food safety practices at the top of mind this season.

title: Fitting in Family Fitness at the Holidays
content: Experts’ top tip on ways to get moving? Involve the relatives who might otherwise stay inactive.
